Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, containing many small white inclusions, and is red and grey in section, five lines of black-painted demotic text appear on the interior, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip, which has flaked away in many places, and bears faint traces of at least a further five lines of text.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393765) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393765)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.8)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 8 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
